CatDescriptText: The sitter, whose name appears on the back of the print, might be Thomas Ware, U.S. Army, listed in the Pittsburgh directory at 4204 Milgate Street in 1945.  He carries the rank of Technician 5th Class, with a Marksman medal with "Coast Art" stamped on the bar below it.  He may have served in the Anti-Aircraft Command.
TitMainTitle: Portrait of man, possibly Tom Ware, wearing U.S. Army uniform with Anti-Aircraft artillery patch on shoulder, Maltese cross on chest, tie tucked into shirt, and technician fifth grade patch on sleeve, posed in front of moire background, in Harris Studio
